alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Harnett, Johnston and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Locally between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Smithfield, Lillington, Angier, Benson, Micro, Selma, Erwin, Coats, Four Oaks, Pine Level, Princeton, Coats Crossroads, Buies Creek and Nahunta. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
